summary:
Leading the corporate development and transformation of a market leader in the pharmaceutical supply chain: knowledge strategy, digital & data transformation, risk management, people strategy.

Interests include: knowledge/strategy intersections; corporate culture as a transformation engine; AI & machine learning; innovation through thought encounters; how to think new things.

education.field_of_study: History of Art & Visual Culture (Art Theory)

awards.title: OxTalent Award
awards.description:
The OxTALENT annual awards recognise members of Oxford University who have made innovative use of digital technology.

Motivation for award:
"The platform makes it possible to not only publish research, but also to engage with the material before and after publication, taking an experimental approach to knowledge production.

The platform went live in October 2016 with a pilot issue, and Issue 1 was published in May 2017. So far, OAR has welcomed 2,800 users and has received about 15,000 page views. It has received praise both nationally and internationally, and has attracted contributions by academics from different fields. The project team has received invitations from leading programmes around Europe to speak about their work."

awards.title: Associate Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (UK)
Wadham College Senior Scholar Award
awards.description: The Senior Scholar Award is granted based on academic progress and excellency.

awards.title: Oxford-Dowding scholarship for a DPhil in the humanities
awards.description: A fully funded scholarship for a DPhil in the humanities.

profile_positions.description:
•	Coaching, mentoring, and managing a department consisting of 5 teams (20 people in total; 5 direct), responsible for Strategic Project Management, Digital Systems, Product Specifications, Compliance and Qualified Persons.

•	Driving multiple yearly enterprise-wide multidisciplinary (matrixed) multi-level stakeholder programmes to timely and successful delivery, including initiative design, proof-of-concept, business case development, milestones and roadmaps, progress monitoring, solution development, and internal & customer communication and alignment. 

•	Steering a digital transformation, focusing on process automation, (agile) digital tool development and customer adoption.

•	Realising a digital and data strategic transformation, focusing on enterprise management and customer intelligence.  

•	Enabling and promoting a culture of LEAN and continuous improvement.

•	Growing the team and ensuring a sustainable future in line with company and department strategic goals by establishing multiple traineeship programmes for high-demand professionals
profile_positions.title: Director Corporate Development

profile_positions.description:
•	Internal consultant to the CEO and senior directors' team on innovation-led growth, change strategy, and brand strategy.

•	Delivered strategic corporate transformation projects, focusing on knowledge strategy, people strategy and continuous improvement.

•	Headed the innovation project team and oversaw its projects, including the complete development of a new service.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Consultant

company.name: OAR: The Oxford Artistic and Practice Based Research Platform

profile_positions.company: OAR: The Oxford Artistic and Practice Based Research Platform
profile_positions.description:
OAR was an online research and publication platform that engaged with original and experimental ways of participating in knowledge production. Its award-winning innovation consisted in harnessing the digital form and format towards enabling and calling-for responsiveness and dialogue across multiple, often siloed disciplines.

•	Directed the team (6 members).
•	Wrote the business case and secured funding from the Oxford University IT Innovation Seed Fund.
•	Oversaw the project development from concept to product, safeguarding the budget.
•	Devised the growth and collaboration strategy, resulting in partnerships strung with leading international institutions, including the Andreas Züst Bibliothek in Switzerland, and the Sciences, Arts, Création, Recherche (SACRe) doctoral programme in Paris, as well as a rise in 475% in readership.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director, Cofounder, and Co-Editor-in-Chief

profile_positions.description:
Guided by the question of 'how to think new things', I developed a new theoretical framework, bringing visual images and philosophical texts in consideration of each other. I presented my work in 2 peer-reviewed publications and 4 international conferences. My viva voce, judged by the renowned Prof. Malcolm Bull and Prof. Alva Noë, was passes on March 9, 2018, without corrections.

As a student representative to the board, I devised a plan for the implementation of DPhil tutorial teaching at my department:
•	Worked in collaboration with the department's academic committee.
•	Conduced market research of +20 Oxford faculties and departments.
•	Designed a ‘teaching package’ that gave students 110% more teaching hours, fulfilled departmental compliance requirements, and met budget limitations.

At own initiative, ideated and co-organised an international academic event:
•	Developed the concept and designed the programme.
•	Invited and negotiated with speakers: 85% success rate, inc. world-leading philosopher Eric Alliez and internationally acclaimed artist David Batchelor.
•	Planned the budget (£1000).
•	Secured funding from the UK Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC), and The Oxford Research Centre in the Humanities (TORCH). 
•	Oversaw a team of 4 volunteers on the day of the event.
•	Attended by +75 participants.
profile_positions.title: DPhil researcher

profile_positions.description:
•	Designed and taught multiple one-on-one tutorial sets (Oxford traditional teaching) and course seminars on both undergraduate and graduate level.
•	Recognised as Associate Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (UK) in January 2017.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer and Tutor

profile_positions.description:
Established a four-week practice-based research residency programme in Wadham College:
•	Proposed the programme following an observed underrepresentation of the practice-based research field at Wadham college.
•	Wrote the mission statement, vision and strategy, including budget plan and expected outcomes and return. 
•	Presented and negotiated the plan at college committees and followed through financial approval, marketing, and selection process, working with the academic office, the development office, the domestic bursar, the communications office, and the College Warden (head of the college).
•	In 2016, there were almost 100 applicants from +20 countries for a single place.
profile_positions.title: Founder of Wadham College Practice-Based Research Residency Programme

company.name: TORCH | The Oxford Research Centre in the Humanities

profile_positions.company: TORCH | The Oxford Research Centre in the Humanities
profile_positions.description:
The TORCH-AHRC fund supports postgraduates’ interdisciplinary projects at the University of Oxford.
•	Evaluated and assessed complex projects, considering their relevance, value and feasibility.
profile_positions.title: Peer-Reviewer

company.name: The Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford

profile_positions.description:
•	Working on innovative approaches to the museum experience strategy, in practice via micro- and pop-up exhibition development and alternative catalogue and information panel contents.

•	Supported by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Associate

profile_positions.description:
•	Liaised closely with the Director and Head Librarian to deliver the project on time.
•	Researched and handled invaluable Old Masters works. 
•	Presented key findings to a group of field specialists, including the Director.
•	Digitised an unpublished manuscript, as part of a project to make the archive publicly accessible.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Taught  introduction to art theory and philosophy to a group of eight adults, from a multicultural and mixed educational background. 
•	All proceeds went to the local charity Jacari, which provides educational support to schoolchildren for whom English is a second language.
